items: Start by lying flat on a bench or mat with your feet planted firmly on the ground.
Hold a dumbbell or cable attachment with both hands and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
Slowly lower the weight behind your head, keeping your elbows close to your ears and your upper arms stationary.
Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then use your triceps to lift the weight back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.

content.title: Cable Lying Triceps Extension Form & Visual

items: Targets the triceps muscles, helping to build strength and size in the back of the arms
Allows for a greater range of motion compared to traditional triceps exercises, such as skull crushers or triceps dips
Engages the core muscles, helping to improve overall stability and balance
Can be easily modified by adjusting the weight or cable height to accommodate different fitness levels and goals
Can be performed with a variety of equipment, including cables, resistance bands, or dumbbells

Reverse Grip Cable Lying Triceps Extension
